definition[0]: an event that is caused by natural forces, such as a storm, flood, or fire, which you cannot prevent or control
definition[1]: a natural event such as a storm or an EARTHQUAKE. No one can be held to be legally liable for damage caused by an act of God, and insurance companies will not usually make payments for such damage
example[0]: The Court held that the rainfall was not an act of God and that the Corporation were liable.
